A few concerns... The sizing is confusing to me, it does not follow standard retail sizes. What about waistband rolling? That seems to be an issue that a lot of men can't stand in underwear. I would also agree with the longer legs, and research into tag comfort. Out of curiosity, How many prototypes you have looked at for your underwear? It might improve backer confidence if you show the amount of research that went into the project, rather than: we took a Cadillac, removed some features, and now we have the American made Honda of underwear, retailing for the same price. I think if a company made just a good Boxer-brief and nothing else, they might do very well. I will still back the project and I hope you have the steam to keep it going! Underwear comfort is a very personal thing for me and it matters a lot when I buy new stuff later down the road. You definitely aren't losing control of your business by taking a few suggestions from the community at large; we are your customers, after all. A one to two week delay is also fine with me. Thank you.
I also vote in favor of longer legs for the boxer-briefs and a tagless design.
a tagless option would be fantastic, or at the very least not having horribly uncomfortable tags.
definitely get into making white v-necks. I love the idea of paying for quality without wasting most of my money on branding.

I second Noorick's suggestion, Good simple t-shirts, especially if they can work as undershirts. I am also in need of breathable (pocketless) polos. (I work for Starbucks and currently our company merchandise site doesn't carry any made in america uniform approved shirts). So, I get to wander around my city looking for plain polos that aren't super heavy weave (I live in Hawaii, we need the most breathable close possible and I would assume all other sun-belt stores would be in the same position).

Ditto on the longer legs, it seems too high, I like the length on the Staffords, they are slightly shorter than Hanes and Fruit of the Loom. But the current length is just too short, they look like booty shorts for women.
I'm on board too and I second the vote for longer legs on the boxer-briefs. I'll also put in a vote for a tagless design. I like this project and look forward to seeing it succeed.
Found out about this via a plug on Now I Know newsletter ... and now I'm backing.
Okay, I'm onboard, but as a boxer-brief man I have to say that your b-b prototype is more brief than boxer. Where's the leg, man? This looks like something from the International Male catalog.

They already have a kind of made-in-USA underwear, but unfortunately it's not that great. If you can make a pair of boxer-briefs that doesn't trap a liter of water in your nethers, then definitely hit up Duluth Trading! :-)

campaign.story:
Confectionize is Customized Confections Like No Other!
What we do:
We make Confections made exactly the way you want it. No matter how unusual. Our customized confections are based on the belief that nobody else should decide what tastes good to us or what we should like to eat. This is our innovative idea behind our company Confectionize.
Confectionize is the world’s first company that lets you create your own Confection the way you want it. At Confectionize, customers start by selecting their favorite Confection base (Marshmallow, Chocolate, or Caramel) and then build on that base by adding up to five fine ingredients from a selection of over 100 to create their own personal confection. This allows for more than a billion tasty combinations!
With Confectionize
• You choose all the ingredients for your confection from our selection of over 100
• You get only the finest freshest ingredients.
• Your confections are handmade fresh-to-order and shipped to your door with a satisfaction guarantee. If you don't love your custom creation, you'll get a new creation free of charge.
• Your customized confections name is printed on each box.
Why I started Confectionize:
My husband and I love making and eating Confections, enjoying those sweet treats that just put a smile on your face and keep’s you wanting more. We are also two parents who have a passion for creating confections; we began creating custom confections together about 5 years ago at home as a treat to suit our own tastes and those of our children. We think there is a lot of people out there just like us that get bored of the things they can buy from a big box store that are old and stale and just taste bland and are looking for something new and different.
Our mission is to let you choose what you want in your confection so you can have the finest handmade gourmet confection with our own personal touch and with so many possible combinations you will never get board of the same old thing. We strive to change the very concept of the basic confections like marshmallow, caramel, and chocolates beyond the ordinary to the truly unique, and to inspire everyone to make new interpretations of these timeless classics. We will make all of our Confections in a small commercial kitchen by hand in small batches with the finest and freshest ingredients possible. We pride ourselves on our original recipes that let you create delicious flavors and use unique ingredients that will surprise and delight your palate. Enjoy!
Company Info
Confectionze was just started a few months ago. It has taken a tremendous amount of time, thought, effort, and money to get to this point. WE ARE SO VERY CLOSE! With your help, we can really impact the way people eat confections. Here is what we have so far, followed by what we need:
What We Have (So Far):
• Our Website! Check it out: www.confectionize.com
• Applications for Licensing and all the Legalities… We will be operating at an approved commercial kitchen in Boise, ID. We have applied for all of the required certifications, permits, and licenses that are needed.
• Labels, packaging, and packaging equipment.
• Small inventory of ingredients.
• Small Amount of Equipment
What we need:
• Equipment!!! We have a limited amount of molds right now and we need a few more polycarbonate molds and silicone molds to make our confections. We currently temper chocolate by hand and could really use a chocolate tempering machine, we could also use more pots and pans to make our caramel and marshmallows, the more we can increase these things the More Confections for everyone and that’s not a Bad thing right!
• Retail Packaging…. We have already created and sourced our online order packaging, but still would like to develop & buy our retail packaging. We also have to meet the retailer’s requirements for their prized shelf space…. *sigh*!
First funding goal is $250 this will cover the cost of the polycarbonate and silicone molds we need.
I am setting a Second funding goal of $1250.00 this will cover the cost of all the molds we need as well as a tempering machine for our chocolate. Reaching this Goal will also give everyone that pledged $20.00 or more an extra chocolate bar or Caramel Bar with up to five toppings, as always your choice on how it’s made.
Our Third funding goal is $3000.00 this will cover the cost of our dream tempering machine for our chocolate and more pots, pans and a larger cooling rack more of everything. So if we can reach this Goal I will sweeten the deal and give everyone that pledged $20.00 or more something we will only offer to our Kickstarter friends that is not available on our site maybe some English Toffee, Peanut Brittle or a Caramallow (a caramallow is a marshmallow wrapped in caramel) your choice of one of the three. Just remember these can only be given through Kickstarter there will be a few options with these as well so you can customize these to your personal tastes.
WE NEED YOUR HELP!
• Help us make this the most Legendary Kickstarter campaign EVER! We understand if you cannot contribute monetarily, but please help us by getting the word out and sharing our project on Facebook and Twitter. We would appreciate your support in any form!
• We can all enjoy fresh custom made confections; it all starts here...it all starts with you….
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

comments.content: The last laugh AHhAHAHHAhhahahaahahah... Damn I still got taken for $$ .. OK it is out of my system. This is such a dead project... The first one I got stiffed on. Just had to check back in & see if there was any activity... NOPE ... Cheers all
Hah! Cheers back at ya a couple years later. :)
REEEEFUNDDDDDDDD!

You know, the whole kickstarter thing is a gamble. For me it's partly the excitement/voyeurism of watching a new, *potentially* successful business emerge. Yeah, this one didn't make, but I personally view the kickstarter thing as a whole. For every one that doesn't come together, dozens do. I've gotten cool things, including some delish candy from another kickstart, and still have my life, my business etc. I never send more for a kickstart than I'm willing to kiss goodbye. Assuming this woman didn't just take the money and run (and I don't think she did), it's like buying a stock that tanks. These things happen.
FYI - Probably hard to make candy when the house has been foreclosed on.

Yeah, I am also one of those people who has sent multiple messages and have not heard back or received my candy. Yeah, my $35 isn't the end of the world by any means, but it's more of the point by now. If she had been around letting us know that there are issues and done something, it would have been different, but she took our money and ran.
I hope to be proved wrong . . . . but I wouldn't bet on it.
To avoid problems, don't over-promise when creating your project. If issues arise, communicate immediately, openly, and honestly with your backers.
and I didnt post her home phone number. I posted the phone number that was published in the LLC Filing with her county. this is publicly accessible information on a government website.

you cant sue a person. she set up a legal entity LLC to hide behind. all I want is my contractual obligations as set out via the kickstarter rules: Send me some shit or give me my money back. this is written in stone in the kickstarter rules.

Guys, let's give her a little bit of a break here. It's not like she is running off on a cruise with our money. I personally believe she did everything she could, and spent every dime of those funds to fulfill as many backers as she could. $7,000 doesn't go very far in the food business. If you want to sue an honest woman over a candy bar you didn't get - that's up to you. But posting her home phone number is just over the line in my opinion.
and it looks like the home phone number for that address is Home (208) 922-9218
Date filed: 04/30/2012

her other email address for this project was : confectionize@yahoo.com to which I have sent email to without response. Googling around her full name might be 'Jane Parendo St. Jean' from Boise, ID & Meridian, ID Age 42.

If Jane didnt think through any of the assosciated costs of running a business like this, thats sad, but totally not my problem. where we sit now, I have been robbed. Cash has been stolen from me with zero benefit to myself. I did not pay to let someone experience their dreams for a week and then change their mind and give up.

Was actually wondering if there is any way that someone could file a court case in such a way that it ended up on one of those TV judges shows . . . . where the award typically comes out of the fee for being on the show. Some situation where the backers get their money . . . but your also not chopping Jane into little peices and selling them on Ebay to recover the costs.

Mark, I remember this story. There is definitely precedence for this type of issue. I don't want to put Jane into the position Quest was in. I just want my money back at this point. Still no word on my pebble, but I did order gray. They're just as far behind as Jane, but they at least provide us with updates. It's horribly irresponsible of Jane to act the way she's been acting.
http://www.inc.com/eric-markowitz/when-kickstarter-investors-want-their-money-back.html

So . . . . take the high moral road . . . wish Jane whatever karma you want to float her direction, and move on . . . . or get nasty and try to royally mess up someone life over, at worse, checking . . . $200 per person or at most about $1 a day while this process has been going on, which is less than a vending machone cola.

Mark, I also backed the pebble watch which is really delayed in manufacturing and delivery. However, we hear from those project creators. The problem here is that Jane has decided that our pledges aren't worth an update from her. I'm following up with litigation now and would really just rather get a refund than mess with this trouble.
I've pledged to 11 projects . . .and am still waiting on awards on 5 of them.
I was fortunate to get one of the first reward shipments, and Jane made excellent candy! Maybe this could someday be a seasonal business, Thanksgiving through Valentines Day.
I hope this project actually follows through and that she responds soon. I want to be proven wrong.

I followed up with Kickstarter, Amazon Payments, and with several email addresses I have for her. I also have an address for her, but I'm not sure that writing a physical letter will produce better results. I've given her until the end of January before following up with legal counsel. At this point I just want a refund. It does look like she's having financial trouble, so I suspect she use her investment for personal gain. I will follow up here if/when I hear from her or at the end of January with information and legal counsel. Because of the terms of her agreement she signed we have a strong case. I just hope she does the right thing and doesn't take it that far.
I wonder, though, how many people literally vanish off the face of the earth on these projects instead of just getting in way over their heads on what it actually costs to deliver on the project.
I do believe she has cut & run on the project. I hope she proves me wrong, but not logging in since Oct 1st - She has cut & run.

Jane, can you please provide us with an update? It's the holiday season and a lot of us spent money backing this project that could have otherwise be spent on family. It's only fair that you provide an update. If things have fallen through on this project you should refund our money. I've already been contacted by a lawyer who wants to start a class action suit against you and I really don't want to pursue that avenue.

I have sent a couple of messages over the last couple of months (nice and polite messages) and am starting to worry with everyone else. Is it time to see if there is a way Kickstarter staff can get involved?
Are things going alright over there? Haven't heard anything from you all in a while, and the website looks like it was taken down.
It would be nice to hear something from the creator. We haven't gotten an update since October and I'm starting to worry.
not only the site, but the jane@confectionize email account is disabled as well. I dont think we are going to be getting our rewards...
Site is no longer available, Has anyone received their rewards yet?
Wouldn't be the first KS project to get swamped or have issues providing their rewards, although lengthly delays in updates is never a good sign.
Confectionize
Time for an update?
Hi....is mine on the way soon?

Thank you. I got mine today, put in the fridge to cool down (it was hot out). Then tried one of the chocolate marshmallow ones. mmmmm delicious! Can't wait to try the rest (and try not to eat all of them in one day)!
Congrats on getting funded!
I know it sounds a little weird, and I did not see it obviously listed, but would you be able to do crushed up kettle style potato chips?
Hopefully, all the cash will not just go to the USPS shipping out boxes of candy! The flat rate boxes alone might be close to $1,000!
Congratulations on your funding triumph! I can't wait to taste some confections.
Note: Your video of doing caramel shows you adding a drizzle of chocolate over the top which isn't an obvious add on your ingredient list - but sure looks like a winning finishing touch!
How are you doing the extras for the backers who are getting a monthly "subscription"?
Whoop! Broke $5k and still going strong.

How could you possibly make a decision on the perfect candy without working through a couple different choices first? Grin I know this invalidates the concept of Customized creations, but any chance that you might at some point have a "variations on a theme" option? Where you end up with single bite pieces - the base and nuts/fruit being the same, but spices and toppings perhaps being different? Or just too much trouble?
Can you make bacon one of the toppings?

I'm all in on this, since I'm all about the hand made confections. Ever since the Army moved me, I can't go into the shop anymore and get William Dean confections. These are even better since I get exactly what I want.
Love this project!
These look so good! Om nom nom nom...

campaign.story:
Yep! This project is all dedicated to cheese. Crumbly, creamy, firm or soft - there are so many cheeses in the world that all have some individual character to them. The Cheese Map is a project that shows the origin of different cheeses. And there's something pretty amazing that happens when the cheese texture takes place of a country's topography.
The cheeses deserve all the pixels they can get, so I will take high quality photographs of every cheese involved in this project. The maps will be printed on matte coated, medium thick paper.
The maps you can see below may just be the beginning of this. With your support, I would love to explore more cheeses. My goal is to create a world map where all countries with a cheese tradition are represented by a cheese they produce. I can't wait to see what this will look like and I really hope to be able to produce it so that I can share it with you as well.
Thank you so much for checking out my project. The Cheese Maps are excited to meet your walls soon!
www.thecheesemap.com
Music credits: State Shirt - "Computer"
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
The prints arrived safely from Norway and I have now prepared and shipped most of the rewards. Watch out for this cheese-nuanced envelope coming your way!
Thanks again so much for helping me create all these maps, it's been a really fun adventure.
Yours truly,
Guri

Good news! Most of the maps are now completed and printed. I found the right type of paper quality and print finish at a print shop in Norway. The paper is thick, smooth and silk matte - which makes the cheese come out really good. Unfortunately, the print shop wasn't able to finish the order before I was headed back to the US, so I am having the order shipped to New York. As soon as I receive it, I will send the separate rewards out.
I am sorry that there's been a little bit of a delay with shipping the rewards. The road from having the idea and a picture in my head of what this should look like to getting a hold of the different cheeses, creating the maps and finding the best way to print them, was a little longer than I first expected. That said, I think the result has gotten better through all these different test prints and adjustments along the way.

Dear Cheese Map backers.
Once again, thank you for helping me make The Cheese Maps happen! I've been photographing lots of cheeses the past couple of weeks, and I am aiming to have most of the maps ready by the end of next week. It's been a lot of fun, and I am excited to share this with you.
To celebrate this project, I want to invite you to an event that I will be hosting together with Bedford Cheese Shop on Saturday 30th of June. I know that many of you don't live in New York City, but I wanted to give you all the opportunity to come, in case you happen to be around that weekend.

Thank you -- thank you -- thank you!
I am so happy that you wanted to back my project and help me raise enough money to produce The Cheese Maps. When the campaign ended on Sunday, we landed on $ 2,787. This covers the printing, shipping and other expenses related to the project at this stage.
I will contact those of you who requested specific cheeses or countries that I haven't already gotten inquiries from. The world map will require most time and attention from here on. Feel free to contact me if you want to have a saying in the process of mapping cheese to a country.

updates.update_userinfo: The Cheese Maps will be funded!
updates.update_content:
I am so excited to tell you that The Cheese Map will be funded thanks to all of you wonderful backers. The feedback from you have been amazing and I've gotten lots of new countries requested. I will keep you posted on the production of the maps and get back to you with more details on this soon.
In the meantime, I still appreciate new requests for countries as part of creating the world map of cheese. All the funding above my original goal will support this further work.
